description.narrative: MS/ActionAid’s partnership with DANIDA under the DAPP Framework Agreement aims at “Harnessing youth leadership and sustained civil society action to demand accountability from duty bearers on youth specific issues and equality, access, equity and gender responsiveness in public services”. As part of the programme implementation MS/ActionAid has led processes of strategic thinking and capacity development of youth, movements, civil society organisations (CSOs), women’s rights organisations and marginalised groups, including trainings, organisation development and reflection sessions and provision of financial support for them to directly implement their interventions towards the actualisation of change. We have also supported our partners in building stronger networks and constituencies. Finally, through the programme MS/ActionAid also facilitate the establishment of physical safe spaces and platforms for actions for young people, including the youth-led Community Centres in areas with a high concentration of marginalised youth, women and refugees and an urban Youth Hub in Amman.
